lines.text: Mr. Duck, why does everything happen to you?
Just listen to him blame me for his carelessness.

[painting a sign reading "Think!"]
"Think!" That's a good thought.
Howdy! I'm J.J. Fate, fall guy. My middle name is Jonah, and Jinx is in there, too. Hoodoo fits me like a glove, but Fate's my name to you.
Mr. Duck doesn't mean to goof, but everyone knows an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of... hey!
[Donald's tie gets caught in a punching machine, and his suit gets punched full of holes]

[Watches Donald get flattened by machine]
This maneuver brings to mind that old Chinese proverb...
work should have flat concentration from you, or you might become flat work.

[seeing Donald trampled by co-workers rushing to leave at quitting time]
Tsk-tsk-tsk-tsk-tsk. And on his own time, too. Well, that's fate.
At home, Mr. Duck is Old Man Fire Prevention himself. But...
[shows Donald at work, standing on a ladder and painting a sign that reads "No Smoking" all while smoking a cigar]
[Donald drops his cigar into a can of paint thinner]
[the cigar causes the thinner to explode]
